summary: This is the First Quarterly Accounting filed in the probate proceedings for the Estate of Jeffrey E. Epstein in the Superior Court of the Virgin Islands. It covers the period from August 10, 2019 (Epstein's death) to December 31, 2019, detailing the estate's assets, cash flow, liabilities, and claims. The document is submitted by the estate's legal representatives and co-executors. This document is a detailed accounting of the Estate of Jeffrey E. Epstein, covering the period from August 10, 2019, to December 31, 2019. It includes schedules of cash on hand, entities owned, income collected, expenses paid, funeral costs, creditor claims, and a list of pending civil lawsuits against the estate. The document reveals the estate's significant financial holdings and numerous legal claims. This document appears to be a series of bank statements and check images from First Bank and Banco Popular de Puerto Rico for an account associated with Jeffrey E. Epstein. It shows account details, balances, and transaction summaries, indicating financial activity and account management.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein's estate had total assets valued at approximately $628.3 million as of August 10, 2019, which increased to about $634.8 million by December 31, 2019.
The estate's cash on hand decreased from $9.44 million at Epstein's death to $7.60 million by year-end, after accounting for income, expenditures, and creditor payments.
Significant liabilities include unknown amounts for civil litigation claims, gift & estate tax liability, and income tax liability, indicating ongoing legal and financial uncertainties.
The estate holds a 50% membership interest in 'ICY AYH St. Thomas Holding LLC' and other entities, with many assets (artwork, collectibles, jewelry) still to be appraised.
Darren K. Indyke and Richard D. Kahn are the co-executors of the estate, responsible for its administration and fiduciary duties.
The total value of entities owned by Jeffrey Epstein was estimated at $618.7 million as of August 10, 2019, and $627.1 million as of December 31, 2019.
The estate's cash on hand decreased from $9.44 million in August 2019 to $7.60 million by the end of December 2019.
Schedule G lists over 20 separate civil lawsuits filed against the Epstein estate, its representatives (Indyke and Kahn), and associated entities, primarily in the Southern District of New York.
Significant expenses included a $68,030 payment to 'Virillis Watson Towers - Aviation' and over $86,000 in funeral and death-related expenses.
The document shows payments to legal firms including Troutman Sanders LLP and Steptoe & Johnson LLP, with over $400,000 in legal fee applications pending court approval.
Financial records show Jeffrey E. Epstein held accounts at First Bank and Banco Popular de Puerto Rico.
The documents include check images and detailed account summaries, suggesting a review of financial transactions.
Account details show balances and activity, such as a checking account balance of $19,933.23 on one statement.
The records reference service charges for maintaining a combined balance between accounts, CDs, and IRAs.
The document is part of a financial data set (EFTA00075562.pdf) related to the Epstein case.
